item.title: Member Initializer List
item.description: Initialization vs. Assignment in Constructor Member Initializer List class Example { int* m_ptr; public: Example(int* ptr = nullptr) : m_ptr(ptr) { // Member variable m_ptr is initialized directly } }; Initialization happens once during object creation. More efficient, especially for complex types. Required for const and reference members: class Example { const int m_value; public: Example(int value) : m_value(value) {} // Must use initializer list }; Assignment in Constructor Body class Example { int* m_ptr; public: Example(int* ptr = nullptr) { m_ptr = ptr; // m_ptr is default-initialized, then assigned } }; Involves default initialization followed by assignment.
